nexttext:
where $v_b = 1/2-2sin\theta_w^2/3$ and $a_b = 1/2$ are respectively the vector and axial
vector couplings of tree-level $Zb\bar{b}$ interaction, $\beta = \sqrt{1-4m_{b}^2/m_Z^2}$ is the
velocity of bottom quark in $Z \to b\bar{b}$, and $\delta v_b$ and $\delta a_b$ are the
corresponding corrections defined as~\cite{Cao:2008rc,Bohm:1986rj,Hollik:1988ii}
Here $\delta g^b_{\lambda}$ ($\lambda = L, R$) is give by
prevtext:
where $v_b = 1/2-2sin\theta_w^2/3$ and $a_b = 1/2$ are respectively the vector and axial
vector couplings of tree-level $Zb\bar{b}$ interaction, $\beta = \sqrt{1-4m_{b}^2/m_Z^2}$ is the
velocity of bottom quark in $Z \to b\bar{b}$, and $\delta v_b$ and $\delta a_b$ are the
corresponding corrections defined as~\cite{Cao:2008rc,Bohm:1986rj,Hollik:1988ii}
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E2.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\delta v_{b}=\frac{\delta g^{b}_{L}+\delta g^{b}_{R}}{2},\quad\delta a_{b}=%
\frac{\delta g^{b}_{L}-\delta g^{b}_{R}}{2}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>g</mi><mi>L</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>g</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow><mo rspace="12.5pt">,</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>g</mi><mi>L</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup></mrow><mo>-</mo><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>g</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>b</mi></msubsup></mrow></mrow><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>

nexttext:
where $\Gamma_{f{\lambda}}(m_Z^2)$ denotes the vertex loop contributions
and $\Sigma_{b{\lambda}}(m_b^2)$ is the counter term from the bottom quark self-energy.
We perform straightforward loop calculations and confirm the expressions in \cite{Cao:2008rc}.
The results can be expressed as
\begin{eqnarray}
 \Sigma_{b_\lambda}(p_b^2) &=&
    \frac{C_g}{(4\pi)^2} \biggl| g^{\bar{\psi}_j b \phi_i^\ast}_\lambda \biggr|^2
    ( B_0 + B_1 ) (p_b, m_{\phi_i}, m_{\psi_j}), \\
  \Gamma_{b_\lambda}(q^2) &=&
    -\frac{C_g}{(4\pi)^2} \Biggl\{
    \biggl( g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_j b \phi_k^\ast} \biggr)^*
    g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_i b \phi_k^\ast}
    \biggl[
    g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_j \psi_i Z} m_{\psi_i} m_{\psi_j} C_0
\nonumber \\
&&
    + g_{-\lambda}^{\bar{\psi}_j \psi_i Z}
    \biggl(-q^2 (C_{12} + C_{23}) - 2 C_{24} +  \frac{1}{2} \biggr)
    \biggr] (p_{\bar{b}}, p_{b}, m_{\psi_i}, m_{\phi_k}, m_{\psi_j})
\nonumber \\
&&
    -  \biggl( g^{\bar{\psi}_k b \phi_i^\ast}_\lambda \biggr)^*
    g^{\bar{\psi}_k b \phi_j^\ast}_\lambda
    g^{\phi_i^\ast \phi_j Z}
    2 C_{24}(p_{\bar{b}}, p_b, m_{\phi_j}, m_{\psi_k}, m_{\phi_i})
    \Biggr\},
\end{eqnarray}

where $C_g = 4/3$ for the gluino loops and $C_g=1$ for other loops,
and $B_0$, $B_1$ and $C_{12}$, $C_{23}$, $C_{24}$ are Passarino-Veltman functions ~\cite{Passarino:1978jh}.
The notation $(\phi,\psi)$ represents ($\tilde b, \tilde g$) for gluino loops,
($\tilde t, \tilde\chi^-$) for chargino loops, ($\tilde b, \tilde\chi^0$) for neutralino loops,
($H^-, t$) for charged Higgs loops and ($h/a/G^0$, $b$) for neutral Higgs loops.

In addition to $R_b$, we also show the SUSY effects in the forward-backward asymmetry
$A^b_{FB}$ in the decay $Z \to \bar{b}b$:
prevtext: Here $\delta g^b_{\lambda}$ ($\lambda = L, R$) is give by

where $\Gamma_{f{\lambda}}(m_Z^2)$ denotes the vertex loop contributions
and $\Sigma_{b{\lambda}}(m_b^2)$ is the counter term from the bottom quark self-energy.
We perform straightforward loop calculations and confirm the expressions in \cite{Cao:2008rc}.
The results can be expressed as
\begin{eqnarray}
 \Sigma_{b_\lambda}(p_b^2) &=&
    \frac{C_g}{(4\pi)^2} \biggl| g^{\bar{\psi}_j b \phi_i^\ast}_\lambda \biggr|^2
    ( B_0 + B_1 ) (p_b, m_{\phi_i}, m_{\psi_j}), \\
  \Gamma_{b_\lambda}(q^2) &=&
    -\frac{C_g}{(4\pi)^2} \Biggl\{
    \biggl( g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_j b \phi_k^\ast} \biggr)^*
    g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_i b \phi_k^\ast}
    \biggl[
    g_\lambda^{\bar{\psi}_j \psi_i Z} m_{\psi_i} m_{\psi_j} C_0
\nonumber \\
&&
    + g_{-\lambda}^{\bar{\psi}_j \psi_i Z}
    \biggl(-q^2 (C_{12} + C_{23}) - 2 C_{24} +  \frac{1}{2} \biggr)
    \biggr] (p_{\bar{b}}, p_{b}, m_{\psi_i}, m_{\phi_k}, m_{\psi_j})
\nonumber \\
&&
    -  \biggl( g^{\bar{\psi}_k b \phi_i^\ast}_\lambda \biggr)^*
    g^{\bar{\psi}_k b \phi_j^\ast}_\lambda
    g^{\phi_i^\ast \phi_j Z}
    2 C_{24}(p_{\bar{b}}, p_b, m_{\phi_j}, m_{\psi_k}, m_{\phi_i})
    \Biggr\},
\end{eqnarray}

where $C_g = 4/3$ for the gluino loops and $C_g=1$ for other loops,
and $B_0$, $B_1$ and $C_{12}$, $C_{23}$, $C_{24}$ are Passarino-Veltman functions ~\cite{Passarino:1978jh}.
The notation $(\phi,\psi)$ represents ($\tilde b, \tilde g$) for gluino loops,
($\tilde t, \tilde\chi^-$) for chargino loops, ($\tilde b, \tilde\chi^0$) for neutralino loops,
($H^-, t$) for charged Higgs loops and ($h/a/G^0$, $b$) for neutral Higgs loops.

In addition to $R_b$, we also show the SUSY effects in the forward-backward asymmetry
$A^b_{FB}$ in the decay $Z \to \bar{b}b$:
mathml:
<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML" id="S0.E4.m1" class="ltx_Math" alttext="\delta A^{b}_{FB}\big{|}_{SUSY}\simeq A^{b}_{FB}\big{|}_{SM}\big{(}\frac{v_{b}%
\delta v_{b}+a_{b}\delta a_{b}}{a_{b}v_{b}}-2\frac{v_{b}(3-\beta^{2})\delta v_%
{b}+2a_{b}\beta^{2}\delta{a_{b}}}{v^{2}_{b}(3-\beta^{2})+2a_{b}^{2}\beta^{2}}%
\big{)}." display="block"><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mrow><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mi>b</mi></msubsup></mrow><mo fence="true" maxsize="120%" minsize="120%">|</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>U</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>≃</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><msubsup><mi>A</mi><mrow><mi>F</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>B</mi></mrow><mi>b</mi></msubsup><mo fence="true" maxsize="120%" minsize="120%">|</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>M</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo maxsize="120%" minsize="120%">(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow></mfrac><mo>-</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>⁢</mo><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>⁢</mo><mi>δ</mi><mo>⁢</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>-</mo><msup><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>+</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><msubsup><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>⁢</mo><msup><mi>β</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow><mo maxsize="120%" minsize="120%">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>.</mo></mrow></math>
